definition: the first pot of gold/the initial profits from an economic endeavour
(prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: O chengcheng proposal consume lots of soya sauce, for qiang ginger earn first bucket of gold.
sentences.chinese: 阿澄提议大量消费豉油，为羌姜赚取第一桶金。

sentences.english: In his eyes, perhaps, this pot of gold must be a small fortune.
sentences.chinese: 在他看来，我的第一桶金一定是一笔不小的钱。

sentences.english: The first bucket of gold can make her life full of selectivity.
sentences.chinese: 这第一桶金，让生活的可选择性丰富极了。
